description: From Biblical Hebrew בָּרָא‎ (bārāˀ, “he created”) + מיִן‎ (mīʸn, “kind”) (misunderstood to mean "created kind"), coined by American creationist Frank Lewis Marsh in 1941.

entries.meaning: (creationism) A set of organisms descended from some originally created species (based on the Biblical doctrine of Special Creation); a kind.
